oneOf.title: No timeout
oneOf.description: Indicates that tests should never time out.

oneOf.title: Exact timeout
oneOf.description: Exact timeout duration for a test.

oneOf.title: Multiplicative timeout
oneOf.description: Timeout is applied as a multiple of the default value (30 seconds)

executable.description: The executable to run. Can be a plain basename, an absolute path or a relative path on Windows.

arguments.title: Extra arguments to the executable
arguments.description: The arguments are parsed in the same way as the POSIX shell

headless.title: Run the browser in headless mode

verbose_trace.title: Remove internal stack frames
verbose_trace.description: This field controls whether or not traces caused by errors are trimmed to remove internal stack frames. This includes frames from the Dart core libraries, the stack_trace package, and the test package itself.

chain_stack_traces.title: Whether stack traces are chained
chain_stack_traces.description: Disabling stack trace chaining will improve performance for heavily async code at the cost of debuggability.

js_trace.title: Convert JS traces to Dart traces
js_trace.description: Whether or not stack traces caused by errors while running Dart compiled to JS are converted back to Dart style.

retry.description: This field controls how many times a test is retried upon failure.

add_tags.description: Adds additional tags. This is usually used in a tag definition to enable tag inheritance.

_testConfigurationInner.$comment: presets and on_os can have different properties when used in a test vs runner configuration. We make runnerConfiguration extend from testConfiguration, so this configuration is used when we're definitely in a non-runner configuration context.

presets.description: A preset used in a test configuration can contain test configuration.

on_os.description: Applies test options when a specific operating system is used

allOf.$comment: Runner configurations are a superset of test configurations

filename.description: Filename pattern that the test runner uses to find test files in directories.

names.description: Only run tests whose names match the given regular expressions A test's name must match all regular expressions in names in order to be run.

plain_names.description: This field causes the runner to only run tests whose names contain the given strings. A test's name must contain all strings in order to be run.

include_tags.description: This field causes the runner to only run tests whose tags match the given boolean selector.

exclude_tags.description: This field causes the runner to only run tests whose tags match the given boolean selector. This takes precedence over include_tags

platforms.description: The platforms on which tests should be run.

concurrency.description: The default number of test suites to run in parallel. This defaults to approximately half the number of processors on the current machine. Setting it to 1 will disable concurrency

pause_after_load.description: Indicates that the test runner should pause for debugging after each test suite is loaded but before its tests are executed. This disables concurrency and timeouts.

run_skipped.description: Run tests even if they're marked as skipped.

reporter.description: This field indicates the default reporter to use.

file_reporters.description: Specifies additional reporters that will write their output to a file rather than stdout

custom_html_template_path.description: This field specifies the path of the HTML template to be used for tests run in an HTML environment.

add_presets.description: Commonly used in a preset, it can be used to enable present inheritance by adding the configuration from another preset.

on_os.description: Applies test or runner options when a specific operating system is used
